gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਥਲ ਪਾਪੰ || ਪਰਹਰ ਜਾਪੰ || ਜਹ ਜਹ ਦੇਖਾ || ਤਹ ਤਹ ਪੇਖਾ ||੧੫੯||
transliteration: Jal Thal Paapan|| Par-har Jaapan|| Jah Jah Dekhaa|| Tah Tah Pekhaa||159||
translation: Wherever we shall be able to see, only sin will be visible everywhere instead of the Name of the Lord, both in water and on plain.159.

gurmukhi: ਘਰ ਘਰ ਪੇਖੈ || ਦਰ ਦਰ ਲੇਖੈ || ਕਹੂੰ ਨ ਅਰਚਾ || ਕਹੂੰ ਨ ਚਰਚਾ ||੧੬੦||
transliteration: Ghar Ghar Pekhai|| Dar Dar Lekhai|| Kahoon Na Archaa|| Kahoon Na Charchaa||160||
translation: Even after searching in every home, no worship and prayer and no discussion on Vedas will be seen or heard.160.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਦੇਸ ਢਾਲ || ਜਹ ਤਹ ਕੁਚਾਲ || ਜਹ ਤਹ ਅਨਰਥ || ਨਹੀ ਹੋਤ ਅਰਥ ||੧੬੧||
transliteration: Sabh Des Dhaal|| Jah Tah Kudhaal|| Jah Tah Anarth|| Nahi Hot Arth161||
translation: The vicious conduct will be visible in all the countries and there be meaninglessness instead of meaningfulness everywhere.161.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਦੇਸ ਰਾਜ || ਨਿਤਪ੍ਰਤਿ ਕੁਕਾਜ || ਨਹੀ ਹੋਤ ਨਿਅਾੲਿ || ਜਹ ਤਹ ਅਨਯਾੲਿ ||੧੬੨||
transliteration: Sabh Des Raaj|| Nitprat(i) Koukaaj|| Nahi Hot Niaae|| Jah Tah Anyaae||162||
translation: Evil action were committed throughout the country and everywhere there was injustice instead of justice.162.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਤ ਭੲੀ ਸੁੱਦ੍ਰ || ਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਕਰਤ ਛੁੱਦ੍ਰ || ਤਹ ਬਿੱਪ ੲੇਕ || ਜਿਹ ਗੁਨ ਅਨੇਕ ||੧੬੩||
transliteration: Chhit Bhai Suddra|| Krit Karat Chhuddra|| Tah Bipp Ek|| Jih Goun Anek||163||
translation: All the people of the earth became Shudras and all were absorbed in base acts; there was only one Brahmin there who was full of virtues.163.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਤ ਜਪਤ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਦੇਬੀ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡ || ਜਿਹ ਕੀਨ ਧੂਮ੍ਰ ਲੋਚਨ ਦੁਖੰਡ || ਜਿਹ ਕੀਨ ਦੇਵ ਦੇਵਿਸ ਸਹਾੲਿ || ਜਿਹ ਲੀਨ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਕਰਿ ਦੈ ਬਚਾੲਿ ||੧੬੪||
transliteration: Nit Japat Bipra Debi Prachanndd|| Jih Keen Dhoomra Lochannddoukhand|| Jih Keen Dev Devis Sahaae|| Jih Leen Rudra Kar(i) Dai Bachaae||164||
translation: A Brahmin always worshipped that goddess, who had chopped the demon named Dhumarlochan into two parts, who had helped the gods and even saved Rudra.164.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਹ ਹਤੇ ਸੁੰਭ ਨੈਸੁੰਭ ਬੀਰ || ਜਿਨ ਜੀਤ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਕੀਨੇ ਫਕੀਰ || ਤਿਨ ਗਹੀ ਸ਼ਰਨ ਜਗਮਾਤ ਜਾੲਿ || ਤਿਹ ਕੀਅਸ ਚੰਡਕਾ ਦੇਵ ਰਾੲਿ ||੧੬੫||
transliteration: Jih Hate Sounbh Naisounbh Beer|| Jin Jeet Indra Keene Phakeer|| Tin Gadi Sharan Jagmaat Jaae|| Tih Keeas Channdkaa Dev Raae||165||
translation: That goddess had destroyed Shumbh and Nishumbh, who had even conquered Indra and made him poor; Indra had taken refuge with the mother of the world, who had made him king of the gods again.165.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਹ ਜਪਤ ਰੈਣ ਦਿਨ ਦਿਜ ੳੁਦਾਰ || ਜਿਹ ਹਣਿਓ ਰੋਸ ਰਣ ਬਾਸਵਾਰ || ਗ੍ਹਿ ਹੁਤੀ ਤਾਸ ੲਿਸਤ੍ਰੀ ਕੁਚਾਰ || ਤਹ ਗੲਿਓ ਨਾਹ ਦਿਨ ੲਿਕ ਨਿਹਾਰ ||੧੬੬||
transliteration: Tih Japat Rain Din Dij Udaar|| Jih Banio Ros Ran Baasvaar|| Grah(i) Houtitaas Istrikouchaar|| Tah Gado Naah Din Ik Nihaar||166||
translation: That Brahmin worshipped that goddess night and day, who in her fury had killed the demons of the nether-world; that Brahmin had a characterless (prostitute) wife in his home; one day she saw her husband performing the worship and offerings.166.
Speech of the wife addressed to the husband :

gurmukhi: ਕਿਹ ਕਾਜ ਮੂੜ ਸੇਵੰਤ ਦੇਵ || ਕਿਹ ਹੇਤ ਤਾਸ ਬੁੱਲਤ ਅਭੇਵ || ਕਿਹ ਕਾਰਣ ਵਾਹਿ ਪਗਿਅਨ ਪਰੰਤ || ਕਿਮ ਜਾਨ ਬੂਝ ਦੋਜਕ ਗਿਰੰਤ ||੧੬੭||
transliteration: Kih Kaaj Moond Sevant Dev|| Kih Het Taas Bullat Abhev|| Kih Kaaran Vaah(i) Pagian Parant|| Kim Jaan Boodhe Dojak Girant||167||
translation: ”O fool ! why are you worshipping the goddess and for what prupose you are uttering these mysterious mantras? Why are you falling at her feet and deliberately making an effort for going to hell?167.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਹ ਕਾਜ ਮੂਰਖ ਤਿਹ ਜਪਤ ਜਾਪ || ਨਹੀ ਡਰਤ ਤੳੁਨ ਕੇ ਥਪਤ ਥਾਪ || ਕੈਹੋ ਪੁਕਾਰ ਰਾਜਾ ਸਮੀਪ || ਦੈ ਹੈ ਨਿਕਾਰ ਤੁਹਿ ਬਾਂਧ ਦੀਪ ||੧੬੮||
transliteration: Kih Kaaj Moondakh Tih Japat Jaap|| Nahi Darat Taoun Ke Thapat Thaap|| Kaiho Poukaar Raajaa Sameep|| Dai Hai Nikaar Toub(i) Baandh Deep||168||
translation: “O fool ! for what purpose you are repeating her Name, and do you not have any fear while repeating her Name ? I shall tell the king about your worship and he will exile you after arresting you.”168.

gurmukhi: ਨਹੀ ਲਖਾ ਤਾਹਿ ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਕੁਨਾਰ || ਧਰਮਾਰਥ ਅਾਨ ਲਿੱਨੇ ਵਤਾਰ || ਸੂਦ੍ਰੰ ਸਮੱਸਤ ਨਾਸਾਰਥ ਹੇਤ || ਕਲਕੀ ਵਤਾਰ ਕਰਬੇ ਸਚੇਤ ||੧੬੯||
transliteration: Nahi Lakhaa Taah(i) Brahmaa Kounaar|| Dharmaarath Aan Linno Vataar|| Soodran Samasat Naasaarath Het|| Kalki Vataar Karbe Sachet||169||
translation: That vile woman did not know that the Lord had incarnated Himself for the protection of the people with the wisdom of Shudras and for making the people cautious, the Lord had incarnated Himself as Kalki.169.
